name: Authentic Thai Green Curry with Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
2 tbsp green curry paste (store-bought or homemade)
1 cup Thai eggplant (or regular eggplant), cubed
1 red chili, thinly sliced (optional, for garnish)
instructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the green curry paste and cook, stirring constantly, for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the chicken pieces and cook, stirring, until lightly browned on all sides.
Pour in the coconut milk and chicken broth. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in the fish sauce and palm sugar until dissolved.
Add the red bell pepper, Thai eggplant, and bamboo shoots. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the chicken is cooked through.
Stir in the kaffir lime leaves and Thai basil. Simmer for another minute.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Add more fish sauce for saltiness, palm sugar for sweetness, or chili for heat.
Garnish with sliced red chili (if using).
Serve hot with cooked jasmine rice.
